components.name: Avatar
components.description: An Avatar repesents a user. Avatars can display an image representing the user, or their initials.

components.name: Dialog
components.description: Dialogs inform users about a task or decision that needs to be made.

components.name: Elevation
components.description: Elevations create a sense of depth by applying a drop shadow to an element.

components.name: Menu
components.description: Menus represent a list of items. They can be used within selects or dropdowns.

components.name: Snackbar
components.description: Snackbars provide brief messages about app processes at the bottom of the screen.

components.name: Expansion Panel
components.description: Expansion panels allow you to place details in a container that is initially hidden, but can be opened by the user.

components.name: Navigation
components.description: Navigations organize content or pages within your application.

components.name: Text Fields
components.description: Text fields let users enter and edit text.

children.name: Field
children.description: A field allows a user to edit text, and provides a label and error message. Fields work with Inputs and Textareas.

children.name: Input
children.description: An input is a standalone text input that allows a user to provide or edit a text value.

children.name: TextArea
children.description: An input is a standalone, multiline text input that allows a user to provide or edit a text value.

components.name: Progress Indicators
components.description: Progress indicators provide information regarding the progress of a deterministic or nondeterministic process.

children.name: Spinner
children.description: A Spinner is a nondeterministic loading indicator.

children.name: Loading Dots
children.description: Loading dots are a nondeterministic loading indicator.

children.name: Progress Bar
children.description: Progress bars can represent nondeterministic and deterministic processes.

components.name: Selection Controls
components.description: Selection controls allow the user to select options.

children.name: Checkbox
children.description: A Checkbox represents a boolean value that can be in one of two states, true or false.

children.name: Radio Button
children.description: A Radio button represents one option among several choices.

children.name: Switch
children.description: A Switch represents a value that can be toggled on or off.

components.name: Buttons
components.description: Button represent that an action will occur when the user clicks or touches them.

children.name: Button
children.description: A button represents that an action will occur when the user clicks or touches it.

children.name: Icon Button
children.description: An icon button represents that an action will occur when the user clicks or touches it.

components.name: Chips
components.description: Chips are versatile elements that can serve numerous roles in your application.

children.name: Input Chip
children.description: Input chips represent information, such as an entity or different attributes.

children.name: Action Chip
children.description: Action chips represent that an action will occur when a user clicks or touches it. They are an alternative to buttons.

children.name: Choice Chip
children.description: Choice chips allow for the selection of a single chip from a set of options. They are an alternative to dropdowns and radio buttons.

children.name: Filter Chip
children.description: Filter chips use descriptive words to filter content. They are an alternative to checkboxes.
